events.name: Drupal March Meetup (Open Space)
events.description: Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where the participants themselves create the agenda and make it happen on the spot. Come by this March with all your burning questions about Drupal, and have it answered during the Open Space! This month's open space is sponsored by PayPal Singapore! Agenda 7.00pm: Drinks & networking 7.30pm: Open Space (topics will be created during the session). 9.00pm: End of meetup, more networking Why Open Space? In summary, we want everyone get the most out of the short 2-hour meetup we have every month. We've got rave reviews on the past open space meetups. We encourage participants who attend the presentation meetups to come to our open space sessions for further discussions on the recent presentation topics. Past topics generated: • Effort estimates for Drupal projects • Forms submission, db manipulation, blocks theming, email • Drupal and e-commerce • How to encourage more Drupal adoption? • Define acceptable advertising for FB group • Is open space working for us? • Effective Drupal advice for startups • Coding drupal.sg • Drupal responsive theme • Drupal 8 • e-signature in Drupal • Drupal development phase: scrum / waterfall • Drupal as REST server
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Millenia Tower, 1 Temasek Avenue, Level 14, Singapore 039192

events.name: Intel Mashery API Masterclass - Smart Nation API coLAB
events.description:
At the Intel Mashery API Masterclass, Jason Cormier and Rodney Chua, will be giving you a Masterclass on API creation and management. They'll be joined by special guest, Jordan Walsh, who will showcase how his company, Whispir, uses Mashery API management tools to grow its business.  
This one is for intermediate API users who want to get an in-depth understanding of APIs and how to effectively manage them.   
Also join us at the API LAB for the kick-off, Intel Mashery API Masterclass and themed API Nights (Smart Living, Transport, Travel & Places, and Fintech & Commerce). The whole week culminates in a spectacular Hack Day where you can experiement with over 100 APIs and wow us with their hacks during the show-and-tell.  
  
  
Programme 
Check out the programme here.  
  
More Information 
To find out more about the coLAB visit: http://www.upsingapore.com/smart-nation-api-colab. Got any questions? Or want to  share your API at the coLAB? Drop us an email.

events.name: Code Dojo - Medicine Clash
events.description: Medicine Clash Kata. https://github.com/emilybache/KataMedicineClash 2 sessions 45 minutes each. 5-10 minutes break in between for retro. Please bring laptop with development environment set-up. Brush-up on TDD framework(s) for your language.
events.location: TCC @ CQ Central, 6 Eu Tong Sen Street, 059817, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love SG #007
events.description: Paper #1 - "Designing a dataflow processor using C λ aSH" - Anja Niedermeier, Rinse Wester, Kenneth Rovers, Christiaan Baaij, Jan Kuper, Gerard Smith :: (Michał J Gajda) Paper #2 - "Measuring Cognitive Abilities of Machines, Humans and Non-Human Animals in a Unified Way: towards Universal Psychometrics" - J Hernández-Orallo :: (Vikram Verma) ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
